org.kiji.schema
Class KijiCellDecoder<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.kiji.schema.KijiCellDecoder<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the decoded cell data.
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericCellDecoder, SpecificCellDecoder
public abstract class KijiCellDecoder<T>
extends Object

Base class for decoders that read data from kiji cells. Kiji cells are encoded as Extension records, although for efficiency reasons, this class provides a custom decoder that avoid copying bytes unnecessarily.

Constructor Summary
protected KijiCellDecoder(KijiSchemaTable schemaTable, org.apache.avro.Schema readerSchema, KijiCellFormat format)
          Use a KijiCellDecoderFactory instead to create instances.

KijiCellDecoder

protected KijiCellDecoder(KijiSchemaTable schemaTable,
                          org.apache.avro.Schema readerSchema,
                          KijiCellFormat format)
Use a KijiCellDecoderFactory instead to create instances.

Parameters:
schemaTable - The Kiji schema table.
readerSchema - The expected schema when decoding the data from the cells.
format - Kiji cell encoding format.
Method Detail

decode

public KijiCell<T> decode(byte[] encodedBytes)
                   throws IOException
Decodes the serialized bytes into a KijiCell.

Parameters:
encodedBytes - The bytes from an HBase table cell.
Returns:
The decoded KijiCell.
Throws:
IOException - If there is an error.

decode

public KijiCell<T> decode(byte[] bytes,
                          T reuse)
                   throws IOException
Decodes the serialized bytes into a KijiCell. If reuse is non-null, the implementation may fill it and return it as the KijiCell data payload.

Parameters:
bytes - The bytes from an HBase table cell.
reuse - If non-null, may be filled with the decoded data and used as the data payload in the return value.
Returns:
The decoded KijiCell.
Throws:
IOException - If there is an error.

getPayload

public ByteBuffer getPayload(byte[] bytes)
                      throws IOException
Gets the portion of the encoded byte array from an HBase table cell that has the avro-encoded data payload according to the configured cell format.

Parameters:
bytes - The bytes from an HBase table cell.
Returns:
the portion of the encoded byte array that contains the binary-encoded avro message.
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error (eg. decoding error).

getPayload

public ByteBuffer getPayload(byte[] bytes,
                             KijiCellFormat format)
                      throws IOException
Gets the portion of the encoded byte array from an HBase table cell that has the avro-encoded data payload.

Parameters:
bytes - The bytes from an HBase table cell.
format - Kiji cell format.
Returns:
the portion of the encoded byte array that contains the binary-encoded avro message.
Throws:
IOException - on I/O error (eg. decoding error).

getFormat

public KijiCellFormat getFormat()
Returns:
the cell coding format used to decode from bytes.

decodeData

protected abstract T decodeData(ByteBuffer encodedData,
                                org.apache.avro.Schema writerSchema,
                                org.apache.avro.Schema readerSchema,
                                T reuse)
                         throws IOException
Decodes the data payload given the reader and writer schema. If reuse is non-null, the implementation may fill it and return that object.

Parameters:
encodedData - The avro-encoded bytes of the data payload.
writerSchema - The schema that was used to encode the data.
readerSchema - The schema that is expected by the reader.
reuse - An optional object to be filled and returned to save on object construction (may be null).
Returns:
The decoded avro object.
Throws:
IOException - If there is an error.
